title: White House slams Fox News host Carlson over Jan 6 segment
description: Carlson has been criticised for TV segment that used cherry-picked video to portray US Capitol rioters as peaceful.

title: US Fed still up in the air on speeding up rate hikes: Powell
description: US Fed chief says that while higher and faster rate hikes are possible, it hinges on upcoming jobs and inflation data.

title: Aurat March: Pakistani women rally seeking safe public space
description: Thousands of women rally across major cities challenging patriarchy and highlighting issues such as sexual harassment.

title: Two dead in failed attempt to steal $32.5m from Chile airport
description: A firefight broke out at the Santiago airport when a group of armed men attempted to seize a large shipment of cash.

title: Atlanta’s ‘Cop City’ and the debate over US protest rights
description: The standoff between authorities and opponents of police training facility has become latest free speech battleground.

title: What’s behind the recent protests in Georgia?
description: Thousands angry at a so-called 'foreign agent' bill making its way through parliament.

title: Imran Khan says Pakistan gov’t ‘petrified’ of losing elections
description: Ex-PM criticises the federal government's decision to ban public gatherings which forced him to call off election rally.

title: Layoffs revised up in January but US labour market still strong
description: Even as layoffs rose in January and job cuts were higher than initially thought in 2022, job market remains strong.

title: US investigation finds police abuse, discrimination in Louisville
description: Attorney General Merrick Garland says civil rights probe documented excessive force and bias against Black residents.

title: International Women’s Day protesters demand gender equality
description: People around the world demonstrate, attend conferences and hold artistic events to mark International Women's Day.

title: NATO cautious amid ongoing Nord Stream blasts investigation
description: Leaked US intelligence suggests a pro-Ukrainian group may be behind the September 2022 attacks on the gas pipelines.

title: ‘Foreign agents’ law: Why are protests taking place in Georgia?
description: A 'foreign agent' bill reminiscent of a controversial law passed in Russia has triggered protests in Tbilisi.

title: Antarctic sea ice extent reaches all-time low: EU monitor
description: Diminished ice cover is a major concern because it helps accelerate global warming.

title: World’s first 3D-printed rocket Terran 1 set for debut launch
description: Rocket named 'Good Luck, Have Fun', made of a metal-aluminum alloy, is the prototype of an inexpensive launch platform.

title: In Russia, children opposing the Ukraine war are being targeted
description: A 12-year-old was punished over her anti-war artwork, the latest sign of a growing crackdown against young people.

title: On Women’s Day, watch these five unsung heroes changing the world
description: Remarkable women breaking barriers from Ukraine to Peru. These are some of our favourite Al Jazeera short documentaries.

title: Photos: India celebrates Holi, the festival of colours
description: One of the most popular Hindu festivals, the day also marks the beginning of spring.

title: Greek workers join walkout over deadly train crash, call protests
description: Greeks are calling for accountability after dozens were killed in the country's deadliest rail disaster.

title: Mali’s PM Maiga: ‘We did not abandon cooperation with France’
description: Mali's Prime Minister Choguel Kokal Maiga speaks to Al Jazeera about the security situation in the West African country.

title: Pakistan province bans public gathering ahead of Imran Khan rally
description: Protests and rallies prohibited in Lahore for seven days, hours before ex-PM was scheduled to address an election rally.

title: How skyrocketing inflation has hit Pakistan’s most vulnerable
description: With Ramadan approaching, millions of Pakistanis struggle to put food on the table amid a worsening economic crisis.

title: Syrian women find strength in the aftermath of the earthquake
description: As the world marks International Women’s Day on Wednesday, women in Syria are facing trauma and displacement.

title: What’s International Women’s Day and why is it important?
description: As the world marks International Women's Day, we take a look at the celebration, the theme and its origins.

title: This Women’s Day, there is little to celebrate in South Korea
description: S Korean feminists are determined not to let President Yoon Seok-yul reverse the progress they made in the past decade.

title: How the nuclear lobby scuttled the EU’s anti-greenwashing tool
description: Giving nuclear energy a "sustainable" label in a key EU regulation could derail progress on climate change.

title: Where to watch the Oscars’ 2023-nominated films online
description: Some Oscars-nominated films are still in cinemas, but many are also available online to stream now.

title: An unexpected friendship: A cross-cultural sisterhood in Sweden
description: How a new immigrant from Kazakhstan found friendship - and hope - among a group of women in Halmstad.

title: Ukraine war focuses China military minds on Starlink, US missiles
description: Chinese researchers have scrutinised the effects of US weapons in Ukraine to learn lessons for possible future conflict.

title: Deadly American kidnapping in Mexico: What you need to know
description: Four Americans were hauled off in a pick-up truck after allegedly being caught in the crossfire of a shootout.

title: Nepal says tourists trekking in Himalayas must hire local guides
description: The rule, which will come into effect from April 1, is aimed at ensuring travellers' safety and creating more jobs.

title: The Dalit mothers who were forced to become wet nurses
description: How young Madiga mothers in Telangana, India were once forced to breast-feed the children of dominant castes.

title: UN says malnutrition in mothers soars in crisis-hit countries
description: UN report raises alarm on need to invest in essential nutrition programmes for adolescent girls and women.

title: General strike in West Bank after Israeli raid kills six in Jenin
description: Businesses shut in a number of cities in the occupied West Bank in protest against Tuesday's raid in Jenin.

title: Young Afghan women train as midwives to serve in remote villages
description: UN says an Afghan woman dies every two hours during pregnancy or childbirth in Asia's highest maternal mortality rate.

title: International Women’s Day: The exclusion of Afghanistan’s women
description: Eighty percent of school-aged Afghan girls and young women – totalling 2.5 million people – continue to be out of school

title: Explainer: Carbon capture projects tackling climate change
description: Greensand project is the world's first cross-border offshore CO2 storage effort to mitigate climate change.

title: Georgians protest ‘foreign agents’ draft law on media, nonprofits
description: Proposed law would need certain media outlets, NGOs to register as 'agents of foreign influence'.

title: Rubber duck calendar lands Thai man in jail for insult to monarch
description: Court ruled the desk calendar contained pictures of yellow rubber ducks that mocked Thailand's King Maha Vajiralongkorn.

title: Elon Musk apologises after mocking disabled ex-Twitter employee
description: Twitter CEO had questioned former staffer about his work, disability and need for accommodations.

title: Japan’s Kishida pledges to ‘work harder’ to fix gender pay gap
description: Japan has the widest gap between men and women's pay in the G7 despite government's efforts to tackle gender inequality.

title: Submarine deal expected as Australian PM to meet with Biden in US
description: Australia's Anthony Albanese will travel to US where he is expected to make an announcement on nuclear submarine deal.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 378
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 378th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Taiwan working on ‘itinerary’; McCarthy confirms Tsai meeting
description: It has become easier for Taiwanese officials to meet US politicians, even though such meetings upset Beijing.

title: China blasts Germany over reported plan to ban Huawei, ZTE
description: Chinese embassy says it opposes 'abuse of state power' following report Berlin will ban Chinese firms from 5G network.

title: Could a change to a US communications law break the internet?
description: Lawsuits examining Section 230 could hold Big Tech liable for harmful third-party content online.

title: New report suggests pro-Ukraine groups behind Nord Stream attacks
description: New York Times says new intelligence seen by US officials suggests opponents of Vladimir Putin behind pipeline attacks.

title: British architect David Chipperfield awarded Pritzker prize
description: Chipperfield described as an architect 'radical in his restraint' as he takes home top industry honour.

title: Philippines Jeepney strike drives home modernisation concerns
description: President instructs agencies to reconsider proposals amid concerns about the effect on drivers' livelihoods.

title: White House backs bill to allow ban on Chinese-owned TikTok
description: White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan claims bill addresses “technology-based threats" to Americans.

title: Russia considering challenge to US nominee to head World Bank
description: Moscow consulting with allies about challenging ex-Mastercard CEO Ajay Banga, Russian media report says.

title: US vice president voices support for Texas abortion lawsuit
description: Five Texas women have filed a lawsuit against the state alleging its abortion bans have led to a 'healthcare crisis'.
